item.title: Blockchain Platform Lisk Expands Its Team, Hires PR Agency
item.description:
Blockchain Platform Lisk Expands Its Team, Hires PR Agency

Bitcoin Press Release: The blockchain application platform Lisk has hired two new community members and a PR company. Job openings are currently available for skilled developers and designers as Lisk continues to expand their team. May 20, 2016, Aachen, Germany - As Lisk prepares for the main network launch in the coming days, the company has added two new developers to its team.

item.title: Swiss Defense Contractor RUAG Breach Results in 23GB Of Stolen Data
item.description:
Swiss Defense Contractor RUAG Breach Results in 23GB Of Stolen Data

Swiss defense contractor RUAG was hacked recently and the assailants obtained 23GB of data. These numbers were recently revealed as part of an investigation by Melani, an IT security firm hired by RUAG. For the time being, it remains unclear as to who is behind this breach.

item.title: Chairman Of Russia's Largest Bank Blasts Proposed Bitcoin Ban
item.description:
Chairman Of Russia's Largest Bank Blasts Proposed Bitcoin Ban

Russia's proposed bitcoin ban will hinder blockchain technology's development in the Russian Federation, according to German Gref, chairman of the board at Sberbank (Russia's largest bank by assets) and former Economic Development Minister, speaking at the Skolkovo business school Saturday, according to lenta.ru, a Moscow-based news site.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Watch; Looking Ahead to Asia - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Watch; Looking Ahead to Asia - NEWSBTC

Here's what's on this evening in the bitcoin price out of the Asian session We are heading into the close of the European session on Monday, and it's time to sort out our strategy for this evening's trading.

item.title: $12.7 M Stolen From Japanese ATM's With Forged Credit Cards
item.description:
$12.7 M Stolen From Japanese ATM's With Forged Credit Cards

Credit card theft is becoming a grave threat to the financial ecosystem, and the recent theft of JPY 1.4bn is a clear example of why credit cards are an insecure payment method.

item.title: I'm ditching traditional banks in favor of Bitcoin-and you can, too
item.description:
I'm ditching traditional banks in favor of Bitcoin-and you can, too

I've been interested in bitcoin (BTC) as a concept since its inception. Until recently, however, I considered bitcoin more of a cryptographic experiment than something that could affect my daily life. One of the biggest obstacles for me was practicality. A few years ago, buying bitcoin or selling them in order to get fiat ("real"...

item.title: MAIDsafe Technical Analysis for 05/23/2016 - Another Big Move Imminent?
item.description:
MAIDsafe Technical Analysis for 05/23/2016 - Another Big Move Imminent?

The MAIDsafe digital token rallied quite hard on May 17th, but since then, price has been trading in a sideways fashion and the trading range is getting progressively narrower. A very clear triangle pattern is visible on the 2-hour charts! This tell me only one thing: pressure is building up.

item.title: Ethereum (ETH) Price Trends: 5/23/2016
item.description:
Ethereum (ETH) Price Trends: 5/23/2016

Ethereum is forming a short-term trend, which is also a wave of a medium-term flat. The price has approached the top limit of that flat. On Friday, we found the level of $14, where Ethereum's price formed a turn to decline within a correction toward the whole upward movement, which started at $10.

item.title: How We Were Buying Pizza with Bitcoins in the US, UK and India on Bitcoin Pizza Day 2016
item.description:
How We Were Buying Pizza with Bitcoins in the US, UK and India on Bitcoin Pizza Day 2016

How easy is it to order a pizza with Bitcoin nowadays? Three authors of Cointelegraph have tried to do it in the US, UK and India, and here is what came out of it. I have never purchased anything with Bitcoin in India yet. Ever.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Sailing A Shallow Sea
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Sailing A Shallow Sea

The bitcoin price ship again scraped its hull against something in the mid-$430s (Bitstamp). Evidently, there was no damage, yet the wind is just not billowing the sails. This analysis is provided by xbt.social with a 3-hour delay. Read the full analysis here. Not a member?
